snippet: A new documentary explores the mystery figures in “Lunch Atop a Skyscraper,” a symbolic photograph of Depression-era New York, as well as the identity of its photographer.
abstract: Brothers Sean and Eamonn O Cualain, in their documentary film Men at Lunch, attempt to answer some of the questions surrounding a famous depression-era photograph of iron workers sitting on an I-beam high above New York City.
lead_paragraph: A new documentary explores the mystery figures in “Lunch Atop a Skyscraper,” a symbolic photograph of Depression-era New York, as well as the identity of its photographer.

headline.main: How a Galway Pub Led to a Skyscraper
headline.print_headline: How a Galway Pub Led to a Skyscraper
